column5: Put a hut out just west of Shanty Bay 3 weeks ago, in 100' of water.  Things are slow, not much being caught and the fish that have been caught are full of minnows and barley.  I suspect it will pick up once March rolls around.  Probably back in the hut on Wednesday.  2 trips to Haliburton back lakes, I can't believe the amount of snow and slush.  The tracks are great on my ATV but nothing works on slush.  Buried it in slush in the middle of the lake last week, but got it out pretty quickly thanks to the winch, power auger and large tree branch.  Iced 6 splake in the 2 trips.  Haven't hit any speck lakes but will once the weather gets a little more tolerant for those of us who fish without a shelter.

I first came to this forum about 4 years ago because I had no idea what I was doing for ice fishing. I had a $10 ice combo and a $40 crappy tire auger and if I caught 3 perch in a day I was doing really well. Between awesome advice on the forums and meeting people in person who were willing to show me fishing techniques I STILL CATCH NO FISH BUT HAVE SPENT $5000+ ON GEAR!!! THANKS A LOT!!!  All kidding aside, the reports are great on here but it's the info and the people. It's also in asking the right questions. You can't see a report and say 'what lake was that? What were your GPS co-ordinates?' But you can say 'how deep were you fishing?' 'What were they biting on?'  It's like back at school. If the teacher gives you the answer, you may pass the test but you will never comprehend.  The reports are nice but it's the people and the information that has been invaluable to me.

What kind of phone do you have?  I find it very easy to post pics on my samsung galaxy s5 and im not very tech savy.  I just open a window for OFC and a window for photobucket and copy and paste the code over, just like on a pc

It took a while to find the Lakers for us but I think we found ''The spot''.    With the white out conditions on the weekend, it did a great job blocking out the background. We have been going out miles from shore only to find out we should be just walking to our spots.
Yes Ron.  Seems to be the spot.  Nice.
Have a little free time on my hands so will post a few reports to catch up on my summer and ice fishn. Maybe even resurrect an old favorite.

TapaTalk app is widely used on most other forums. Easy picture downloads without having to use photobucket & real time fishing reports from your smartphone. Maybe TJ, Roy or Art might want to look at this???

Apologies to Roy, who I respect, but, you're on the wrong forum Brian.  Now if you want OPINIONS about everything from  a bunch of guys that KNOW everything. Or, if you want to know how to open a can without a can opener you are all set.
Roys me udder brudder,just from our udder mudder. LOL  Wish I could of got out this weekend.
Post of the year 2015 right there!!  Awesome lol  Hockey threads ??  Target threads ??
Bulls eye Frankie!  All we need is for the rules to say "If your post is about fishing, please put an F at the end of the topic."
I would be happy to post fish pix -but, I gotta get one first!  I'm bored & housebound.  Freezing rain here in Niagara.  Whoops!!   this isn't a fishing report!  LOL!

put this together before I saw your post cause I am now in full "insanity over winter mode". soft water cant get here soon enough for me.     Missed this bud.  Had me doing the fandango.LOL  Great shots.

From day one this board has been a mixture of fishing AND non fishing subjects.  Always has been and probably always will be and has always worked well and will more than likely continue to work well in the future.  As has always been said in the past, if your not interested in a particular post simply move on to something else.

I come here for the non fishing stuff myself. If I want fishing reports or info I go to other places.  This site has lots of great info on fishing related topics, and tech stuff, but fishing reports are history.  S.

From day one this board has been a mixture of fishing AND non fishing subjects.  Always has been and probably always will be and has always worked well and will more than likely continue to work well in the future.  As has always been said in the past, if your not interested in a particular post simply move on to something else.  Were not all like Mike and Drew. Great reads. Im not sure if maybe some think they need to be the same.  A days fishing is a days fishing, no matter how you type it on here.  Hell, I dont care if theres pictures or not. Just your day out.  Maybe some of the negitive comments about a hold or maybe a possible out of season catch, should be dealt with by PM,s. This might help the cause. IMO

I come here for the non fishing stuff myself. If I want fishing reports or info I go to other places.  This site has lots of great info on fishing related topics, and tech stuff, but fishing reports are history.  S.  Shane,I read reports from other boards. Some if not half,have worse grammer and spelling then I. LOL But after time,you get what their sayng.

Were not all like Mike and Drew. Great reads. Im not sure if maybe some think they need to be the same.  I wasn't referring to your initial post Brian, just saying that non fishing topics have always been a large part of this board and that's just the way TJ  has always wanted it and to me anyways I think it's great.
GOTCHA  Lew

I wasn't referring to your initial post Brian, just saying that non fishing topics have always been a large part of this board and that's just the way TJ  has always wanted it and to me anyways I think it's great. That is why this board has thrived over the years while many others have not. We are a diverse group of people with a wide variety of intrests and opinions but we share a common love; fishing.  As for fishing reports it is really hard to post anything of substance anymore without offending someone, locations tactics, to keep or not to keep. I gave up a while ago because someone thought everyone would know I must be talking about Sturgeon Lake because that is where I live and I shouldn't be telling people how the fishing was here.  Anyway, still the best site on the internet!
Have to agree,the best site out there just because of that reason.Little something for everyone.!!!!!!  .
It's not often but it does happen occasionally and in this case, recently.
Dinner for one.LOL
Dinner for one.LOL  If I had of kept that one and the rest of the afternoons catch it would have been dinner for several. All were released for another day.
Sounds like a superb day. Nice.
Leafs are history again for another season.   Lets see some fishing reports.              What the science paper I sent you isn't keeping you interested?

Agreed!  I come here for the fishing reports, but also a strong interest in the other various topics people discuss.  The tech stuff is important to me!  Roofing, electrical, outboard repairs/maintenance, batteries, atvs, sleds - it's all here.  No need to go elsewhere.  To me this site is like a giant book of knowledge & the topics change daily, sometimes hourly.  Keep up the good work!!

I like the mix of this forum.  I can't stand going to some forums where there are 50 different sub forums.  As for the fishing reports, I don't think there are many that do it anymore.  I lost that urge many years ago.  Too many freeloaders out there on the Internet.  I just like to read about different things that touch on fishing, and if a target thread pops up, I can choose to read it or not.  Fishing forums are just enjoyable places to pass the time for me, I don't get wrapped up in them, it's not real life.  There isn't much here that phases me. The only thing I don't love is the advertisement reports, but even then you get to know the players and can choose to skip their posts, so no big deal!  I sometimes find I get the most interesting info out of non fishing threads.
Leafs are history again for another season.   Lets see some fishing reports.

This is my son's first year playing hockey and I made an outdoor rink. So I'm spending more time on the ice then I have for a lot of winters but I haven't even strung up an ice rod yet.  Hockey season ends at the end of February so maybe I'll get out before break-up.
went out of ibp  caught 6   8" perch  did not take pics and did not keep any  had lots of fun running the Yamadoo ATV around
I knew that was coming  Terry  had a 2nd Christmas, nice machine you built.

This is my son's first year playing hockey and I made an outdoor rink. So I'm spending more time on the ice then I have for a lot of winters but I haven't even strung up an ice rod yet.  Hockey season ends at the end of February so maybe I'll get out before break-up.   Been there and done that bud. Cuts into a lot of fishing time. I,ll bet your enjoying it though.   Who you trying to kid. You dont catch fish.   A little birdy tells me the smelt are hitting.
Went out of IBP yesterday where you told me to go..... 47ft..... caught quite a few perch..... caught 3 keeper perch 9-10".... and one small white fish..... ate them for lunch today lol.....  Burt

Went out of IBP yesterday where you told me to go..... 47ft..... caught quite a few perch..... caught 3 keeper perch 9-10".... and one small white fish..... ate them for lunch today lol.....  Burt  SSHHHHHHHHHHH Dont tell Terry.LOL  Nice going Kev.

I was out a couple of days ago, when it was ovecast. Caught two long skinny bass on a Blue Fox spinner and another on a shaky-head worm. It hit 80 since then, and I am waiting for the fish to acclimatize.

That's the 1 thing I miss about this place is a full list of reports every time you log in. It's always hockey or family/crap talk....witch is ok but you just don't see reports on here like we did 3 or 4 years ago...Still lot's of great people on here but i think this is more of a outdoors forum than a fishing forum anymore...I try my best to post reports when I get out on the lake don't know why guys don't put in the effort anymore.
I went 0-5, Simcoe, Gull, Bernard, Presquille bay and...... Ummmm...... Somewhere else. I forget (or tried to block out).  This is why I don't do reports.   BIG WIND! That was number 5!

My guess is the general negativity that usually encompasses responses to reports, whether its "general locations" hot baits, pics that don't blur backgrounds blah blah blah. Look back 2 or 3 years in the archives and there's quite a few locked report threads where discussions turned nasty.  I for one agree with you Mike, I used to love read reports here but it certainly not because reporters are getting lazy... I recall several times where someone has stated "I will never post another report here ever again". Looks like they were true to their word.
Fishing will resume early March Brian.  Probably an ice report come April when nobody will give a crap about seeing ice reports.

Have to agree with just about everything as to why not many reports. The ice reports we do get like the beauty from Moosebunk are tough to compare to reporting 3 keeper Perch and a Whitefish or 2 so I don't think most even bother. It is more of  social kitchen table coffee chat during these winter months.
Now if misfish were still reporting that would help.
Would love to be posting reports right now. Just having to stay close to home. Not much opportunity to get out. I am making a lot of tackle right now, but it keeps me busy.

Hit Loughborough Lake again yesterday.  ATV travel was just barely possible, and when we packed it in, our tracks had already snowed over and with not much more snow we'd still be shovelling........Since then another six inches or so has fallen.  You want to ride your ATV out there, it had better be equipped with tracks.  Buddy caught one nice fat lake trout and missed two.  I missed two.  Rubber hooks?  The End.  Oh yeah, and came back to my perfectly legally parked truck to find some dimwit had left a parking infraction notice on my windshield.

I went 0-5, Simcoe, Gull, Bernard, Presquille bay and...... Ummmm...... Somewhere else. I forget (or tried to block out).  This is why I don't do reports.   BIG WIND! That was number 5!  don't forget about Fairy, sorry bud but that is 0-6  but i hope today made it wroth while and I think it deserves a write up, in fact I'm going to do that now
put this together before I saw your post cause I am now in full "insanity over winter mode". soft water cant get here soon enough for me.
I have been hitting simcoe but nothing out of the ordinary, i usually post reports when i go somewhere else or i have a story to tell haha. I went 0 for 0 Pike fishing today.
If it was easier to post pics from mobile I would post reports once in a while. I havent fire up the laptop or PC for ages.  S.
I agree with this too. I have to put my pics on my phone, then upload them to photobucket, then hyperlink them in my post.

I agree with this too. I have to put my pics on my phone, then upload them to photobucket, then hyperlink them in my post.  May I suggest that use both their phone and a computer like I do, I would suggest that you download the Photobucket App, It makes it allot easier and then you don't have to worry about getting your photos from your phone to your computer because as soon as you up load it to the app it will be on your Photobucket account, of course you'll need an  account with them. I'm sure there are other sites and apps, I just happen to use Photobucket myself
